briefTitle: Study to Assess the Efficacy of Anti-Bet v 1 Monoclonal Antibodies in Adults to Reduce Symptoms of Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
officialTitle: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Assessing the Efficacy of Anti-Bet v 1 Monoclonal Antibodies to Reduce Symptoms of Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
summary: The primary objective is to assess the reduction of allergic symptoms as measured by combined symptom and medication score (CSMS) during birch pollen season after a single dose of REGN5713-5714-5715 versus placebo.

primaryOutcome.measure: Combined Symptom and Medication Score (CSMS) in Participants Who Receive a Single Dose of REGN5713-5714-5715 Versus Placebo
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Until the end of Birch Pollen Season, up to Week 16
